p: Regarding to carotenes, the levels of α-carotene and β-carotene were below of 0.40 mg g -1. Considering the marine microalga Dunaliella salina, which is used for the β-carotene commercial production, it produces on average 5–10 mg per gram of dry weight ( Deli et al., 2014), in this sense the microalgae evaluated in this study presents low yield in these carotenoids.
